intro: Sium radiatum, commonly known as water parsnip, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Sium radiatum thrives in moist soils and is often found along streambanks and in marshy areas.
